description: Nice 1967 Pontiac Firebird Convertible V-8!
Excellent investment here since Firebird Convertibles hold their values quiet well and this one is harder to find in this color.

Nice presentable driver equipped with a strong running 326 V-8. Auto transmission shifts good through all gears, dual exhaust sounds nice, suspension feels good and takes the road well, good brake pedal with responsive stopping.
YouTube video link: https://youtu.be/2CY8FAHQefc

The exterior dressed in beautiful Verdora Green which makes this car really stand out. The paint is in nice shape with a good glossy finish and overall nice driver quality. Good undercarriage and trunk.
The power white convertible top is in very good condition and works properly. White parade boot included.
Lastly the Interior is in nice condition. The white parchment seats are all clean, good carpet, dash and door panels. Older aftermarket radio works.

If you are serious about making a purchase we encourage leaving a deposit. Remember the old saying “ A car that you looked at today and are thinking about buying tomorrow someone looked at yesterday and will buy today!”

We can have most cars shipped for $600.00-far west additional.
International shipping assistance-pls inquire.

A real U14 half cab that we have done a frame on restoration.  Appears to have all original drivetrain including the 6 cyl and 3 speed manual transmission.  The body has been blasted to bare metal and all rust was fix with new metal. It has all new weatherstrip, new seat covers and dash pad and steering wheel.   The floor has been done in bedliner and the underneath has been detailed with undercoating and painted black.  The truck runs and drives great.  Wipers have been converted to electric, only works on 1 speed.  These are very hard to find.  Our own shop did the restoration and we do very good quality work as can be seen by our trophy's from local car shows.  You are dealing with the restorer not a salesman so I can give you all the details of the Bronco's restoration.  Besides doing the body it goes thru our mechanical shop and we rebuilt the carb, new headlights, new tailpipe, replaced the oil pan gasket, near new wheels and tires.  We also inspect all drivetrain components.   Call for more pictures or video.  Located in White,SD.

You can Buy With Confidence since we have been in the car business for 30 years.  We are a family business and will not sell you anything you don't want.  All of our vehicles are inspected and we will tell you anything that isn't working.  We have around 100 pictures and a video of our classics on our web site http://www.bnbautosales.com.  If you need anything don't hesitate to email or call as we will get any picture or another video to you.  We work and drive these cars so can personally tell you about the car.
1967 MGB roadster

. Some feel the '67 "B" is the best example of a chrome bumper MGB. This car has an excellent older restoration in bright red with a black interior, top and tonneau cover. It is powered by the 1799 cc / 109.8 cui, 98 hp 4 cylinder with a 4-speed manual transmission. An exceptional example. Scroll down for additional Photos.

Up for sale is a ONE-OWNER 1967 Pontiac Lemans Convertible
The car was completely restored in the early 2000s
The body is in excellent shape. Very straight, No rust issues, doors shut effortlessly

The paint was nice quality, thus why it still looks as good as it does ( and being garaged kept) , it does have couple light scratches, and maybe a ding or two , but overall presents very well. It is still taken to shows.
The interior is in great shape, and was done by the original owners wife. Seats are very nicely done with thte two tone black vinyl and black velour, but still retaining the factory pattern.
The convertible top is nice and works just as it should. Also lines up nicely, so no struggling to get it to close.
The Engine is the original Pontiac 326 thats been rebuilt, paired with an automatic th350 trans.
Does have an aftermarket B&M shifter , small tach , and a custom stereo system that can be removed
The Cragar wheels and tires are like new
Asking $22,999

In 1961, the Chevrolet introduced the Impala SS or Super Sport to the market. The new SS badging would soon become Chevrolet's signature of performance on many of its most popular models. In 1965, Chevrolet had redesigned the Impala and the new, fourth generation designs were used with minimal updating through 1970. Chevrolet supplied the Impalas with a variety of engine options that ranged from a six-cylinder to the powerful big block V-8s.

For the 1967 model year, the standard Impala Series was supplied in six body styles while the Impala Super Sport Series consisted of only two body styles: a two-door hardtop, coupe as well as a sporty, convertible. Approximately 67,000 SS coupes were built while only 9,545 SS convertibles were built. The 1967 Impala SS Convertibles had a factory base price of approximately 3,600.00.

This 1967 Chevrolet Impala Super Sport convertible was built and sold new in St. Louis. It was purchased by the current owner from the original owner in about 1983. It today's marketplace, it is difficult to find a desirable, 1960s era convertible that has had only two owners from new and has resided in the same city for all of its life. This car is being sold with a Missouri title with a matching VIN number of 168677S161633, which indicates that it is a true Super Sport and built in February of 1967. The mileage is just under 99,000 from new.

As expected from a two-owner car, this Super Sport Impala Convertible is in excellent, overall condition. The current and second owner has restored this vehicle as needed during his 34 years of ownership. Today, this car is ready to use and enjoy.

The body appears to be extremely clean and straight. All of the bodylines are crisp and clear. The doors, hood and trunk lid fit the body with even gaps and margins. The body panels look straight from front to rear, top to bottom. The car has been recently repainted in the original color of Bolero Red. The paint is in excellent overall condition with an even and consistent gloss across all of the body panels.

On the inside, the Parchment White interior is mostly original and shows extremely well. The seats are firm and the upholstery is clean. The front seats have been recovered in a proper, matching material. The rear seat assembly and the door panels appear to be original and in very good, original condition. The front and rear seats match extremely well. The carpets have been recently replaced and the car is equipped with factory correct seat belts. This Impala SS is equipped with the desirable bucket seats and center console.

The dashboard assembly is clean and retains all of its original gauges and controls. All of the original gauges work properly with the exception of the clock. The current owner has installed aftermarket, oil and temperature gauges for safety purposes. The car retains its original AM radio together with a rear mount manual antenna and a rear seat speaker. The factory installed, manual tinted windows are clean and operate smoothly.

The convertible top assembly has been recently restored. All of the hydraulics have been either rebuilt or replaced as needed. The white top material is nearly new and shows hardly any wear. The top assembly has a glass rear window as well as a matching top boot.

Under the hood, this Impala SS has its original 327 cubic inch/275 horsepower V-8 engine. The current owner has recently rebuilt the engine. It is extremely clean and recently detailed with proper decals and labels throughout. The engine runs extremely well. It starts easily and idles well. The V-8 has a throaty and solid sound as it exits through the dual exhaust. The automatic, Powerglide transmission shifts through the gears smoothly and makes the car easy to drive.       Other original factory options include power brakes, power steering and the desirable factory air conditioning, which all function properly.

This is a great example of a desirable, fourth generation Impala Super Sport Convertible. Having had only two owners since being sold new in 1967 makes its particular desirable amongst today's knowledgeable collectors who place premium values on cars with known and low ownership histories. This 1967 Impala SS Convertible has always been well maintained and actively used. It presents extremely well inside and out and is a pleasure to drive. The first two owners cherished and preserved this great convertible and it is now ready for the third owner to continue the tradition.

1967 Pontiac Firebird Convertible.
This car has been in the same family for years. Elderly father owned it and passed it on to his son. Both took very good care of it and is a well preserved 67 Firebird!
The car is a factory A/C V-8 car and loaded with power steering and power brakes.

The original 326 V8 runs very well. Easy cold starter and has good power. The automatic transmission shifts through all gears nicely and it performs down the road well. BF Goodrich raised white letter tires mounted on rally wheels. We have the original A/C compressor which is currently off the car so A/C in-op.
The exterior is very good driver quality. Black paint has a nice shine (drivers door has a few nicks along edge. )
Solid undercarriage and clean and solid trunk.
Overall car is solid and looks very good!
YouTube video link: https://youtu.be/oTm1xFuUeTM
The power white Convertible top operates up and down nicely. Overall nice shape with a clear rear window. White parade boot included.
The interior is driver quality. All seats etc are in good condition, clean door panels and dash .
Great investment here! This car is priced very competitively and getting very hard to find at this price point particularly in the color black.

In 1961, the Chevrolet introduced the Impala SS or Super Sport to the market. The new SS badging would soon become Chevrolet's signature of performance on many of its most popular models. In 1965, Chevrolet had redesigned the Impala and the new, fourth generation designs were used with minimal updating through 1970. Chevrolet supplied the Impalas with a variety of engine options that ranged from a six-cylinder to the powerful big block V-8s.

For the 1967 model year, the standard Impala Series was supplied in six body styles while the Impala Super Sport Series consisted of only two body styles: a two-door hardtop, coupe as well as a sporty, convertible. Approximately 67,000 SS coupes were built while only 9,545 SS convertibles were built. The 1967 Impala SS Convertibles had a factory base price of approximately 3,600.00.

This 1967 Chevrolet Impala Super Sport convertible was built and sold new in St. Louis. It was purchased by the current owner from the original owner in about 1983. It today's marketplace, it is difficult to find a desirable, 1960s era convertible that has had only two owners from new and has resided in the same city for all of its life. This car is being sold with a Missouri title with a matching VIN number of 168677S161633, which indicates that it is a true Super Sport and built in February of 1967. The mileage is just under 99,000 from new.

As expected from a two-owner car, this Super Sport Impala Convertible is in excellent, overall condition. The current and second owner has restored this vehicle as needed during his 34 years of ownership. Today, this car is ready to use and enjoy.

The body appears to be extremely clean and straight. All of the bodylines are crisp and clear. The doors, hood and trunk lid fit the body with even gaps and margins. The body panels look straight from front to rear, top to bottom. The car has been recently repainted in the original color of Bolero Red. The paint is in excellent overall condition with an even and consistent gloss across all of the body panels.

On the inside, the Parchment White interior is mostly original and shows extremely well. The seats are firm and the upholstery is clean but not perfect. The front seats have been recovered in a proper, matching material. The rear seat assembly and the door panels appear to be original and in very good, original condition. The front and rear seats match extremely well. The carpets have been recently replaced and the car is equipped with factory correct seat belts. This Impala SS is equipped with the desirable bucket seats and center console.

The dashboard assembly is clean and retains all of its original gauges and controls. All of the original gauges work properly with the exception of the clock. The current owner has installed aftermarket, oil and temperature gauges for safety purposes. The car retains its original AM radio together with a rear mount manual antenna and a rear seat speaker. The factory installed, manual tinted windows are clean and operate smoothly.

The convertible top assembly has been recently restored. All of the hydraulics have been either rebuilt or replaced as needed. The white top material is nearly new and shows hardly any wear. The top assembly has a glass rear window as well as a matching top boot. Top boot does not fit well and will need some attention to fit properly.

Under the hood, this Impala SS has its original 327 cubic inch/275 horsepower V-8 engine. The current owner has recently rebuilt the engine. It is extremely clean and recently detailed with proper decals and labels throughout. The engine runs extremely well. It starts easily and idles well. The V-8 has a throaty and solid sound as it exits through the dual exhaust. The automatic, Powerglide transmission shifts through the gears smoothly and makes the car easy to drive.       Other original factory options include power brakes, power steering and the desirable factory air conditioning, which all function properly. The car has been converted to use R134 Freon.

This is a great example of a desirable, fourth generation Impala Super Sport Convertible. Having had only two owners since being sold new in 1967 makes its particular desirable amongst today's knowledgeable collectors who place premium values on cars with known and low ownership histories. This 1967 Impala SS Convertible has always been well maintained and actively used. It presents extremely well inside and out and is a pleasure to drive. The first two owners cherished and preserved this great convertible and it is now ready for the third owner to continue the tradition.

This 1967 Dodge Coronet RT is for sale in our Louisville KY showroom. The Coronet was Dodges full size car from 1949-5p. 1965 rolled around and the much slimmer much lighter Coronet was an intermediate car and produced off the b bodys 117 inch wheelbase. The big news would be in 67 though with the addition of the Coronet RT. This 67 is a great example of what the RT package gave you. Under the hood is a period correct 375 horse fire breathing big block also known as the 440 Magnum. This impressive engine has been brought back to its original bone stock form and is just as impressive today as it was in 67. The original manifolds only make it that much more authentic. Mated up to the best transmission to ever come from MOPAR the 727 is still a sought after piece today. The gold exterior shows nicely with all the correct RT badging there is no way it could be mistaken for anything else. Inside the black interior like the exterior is period correct and shows nicely. The middle console spits between the bucket seats and house the automatic transmission shifter. With these MOPARs only going up in value this Coronet would make a great investment that you can actually enjoy. Options on this 1967 Dodge Coronet R/T include AM Radio Power Brakes Power Steering Power Brakes Seat Belts Vinyl Interior and Rally Wheels wrapped in Radial Tires. This 1967 Dodge Coronet R/T can be seen including an HD video at www.gatewayclassiccars.com call at 812-294-1555 or email

1967 Chevrolet Camaro Convertible Bolero red with red Interior and Black Soft top, Original 327 with Automatic Transmission. Options Include Bucket Seats, Center console, Tinted Glass, Original AM/FM Radio ,  Rally wheels with Redline Radial Tires. Car is complete with spare tire and jack.This is a very well dialed camaro that runs and drives great!

There is nothing like a classic SS Camaro. This Royal Plum beauty was built in Van Nuys. It is equipped with a numbers matching 350, TH350 transmission, power steering, power front disc brakes, aluminum radiator, Deluxe interior, A/C, bucket seats, center console with console gauges, ralley wheels, and Classic Autosound radio.

Gateway Classic Cars of Philadelphia is proud to feature this beautiful 1967 Oldsmobile Delta 88 Convertible! For 1967 Oldsmobile redesigned the Delta 88 with a more sleek and sexy body. This is a one year body style featuring the last year of the full grill and as well as the last year of the high compression 425 CID Super Rocket which is bake by a three-speed automatic transmission. This engine produces 375 horsepower and will pin you back to your seat if you"??re not careful.If luxury is more your style the interior was just restored and seats six comfortably. The seats are as comfortable as your living room sofa. Driving down the highway feels like you"??re floating on a cloud. This vehicle is equipped with Power Steering Power Brakes Power Seats Power Windows Power Top AM/FM Radio Factory A/C and a Posi-Traction rear end.  All of the original gauges have been restored even the clock works! A glass emblem in the center of the steering wheel emblazoned with the Oldsmobile insignia immediately draws the eyes and carries them to take in the entirety of the instrument cluster laid against a backdrop of brilliant woodgrain. This Oldsmobile is so much fun to drive that the factory cruise control was not hooked up. However it was restored both mechanically and in appearance.Additionally this rust free southern beauty was recently painted with GM Victory Red has new dual Manaflow  ® exhaust and a brand-new Power Top. The engine was refreshed less than 15000 miles ago with a new fuel pump oil pump and all new gaskets. Pictures alone do not do justice for this amazing example of one of Oldsmobile"??s legendary cars! To view this 1967 Oldsmobile Delta 88 greater detail including HD pictures and an HD video visit www.GatewayClassicCars.com or our Philadelphia showroom located in West Deptford NJ.
